childnodes.sy: Ooh La La Dessert Boutique has it all: cookies, cakes, pie, gelato, cupcakes and more. Choosing just one thing is nearly impossible, so don’t be shy about ordering a table full of treats the size of your head. Cupcake specials change daily.

Charming French bakery Dolce Delights is famous for their macarons and petite cakes — you have to try the chocolate mint with an Oreo crust. Dolce also offers coffee, smoothies, panini and even recently started serving wine.
Serving up cake balls, macarons, mini pies, cupcakes and more in City Center, Sweet is a true dessert lovers’ happy place. After you try their Key lime mini pie, you’re sure to be sweet on Sweet.

A cute little dessert boutique in River Oaks, Macaron by Patisse serves the best macarons in Houston, and the flavors change seasonally. For a uniquely decadent treat, try the gelato and macaron pushup pops.

Michael’s Cookie Jar opened with the noble mission of making the best all-butter cookies in the city of Houston. The cookies are divided into four categories — Americana, seasonal, fancy and decorated. You can’t go wrong with any of them!
True to its name, everything at The Chocolate Bar is made with chocolate, from the huge selection of cheesecakes to the to–die-for creamy truffle ice cream.

Crave Cupcakes has your quick sugar fix covered. Whether you order a classic flavor like vanilla with chocolate frosting, or something a little different like pumpkin or red velvet, all the cupcakes are made with delicious, artisanal ingredients.
The chocolate croissant bread pudding with bourbon caramel sauce more than lives up to they hype at Red’s Dessert Dive. Dollars to donuts you’ll end up taking a box of extra goodies home.

t: Delectable Sweets for Your Sweet Tooth
